snippet: The state is now producing a million barrels of oil a day, with a large part of the credit going to the rich Bakken shale formation.
abstract: North Dakota's Department of Mineral Resources reports that state is now producing one million barrels of oil a day; successful increase in production is due in large part to rich Bakken shale formation in western part of state.
lead_paragraph: The state is now producing a million barrels of oil a day, with a large part of the credit going to the rich Bakken shale formation.

headline.main: North Dakota Hits Milestone in Oil Production
headline.print_headline: North Dakota Hits Milestone in Oil Production
